Description: Miniature Attic pottery lekanis (reconstructed from several fragments); interior and top of flat rim glazed black (partly fired brownish); exterior: ribbon handle surfaces glazed; band of short strokes around edge of rim; on body, frieze of silhouette swans or geese, painted upside-down on wall; brown line around ring foot; concentric circles and central dot on underside of foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by World Museum, Liverpool. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1856,1208.57 from the Troad.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2097)
